SENT.plain: We report four additional cases of Wiedemann-Beckwith syndrome (WBS): A mother, her brother, and two of her children (half-sibs)
Theories of the genetic transmission of the WBS are reviewed
The trait in this family appears to be an autosomal-dominant with variable expressivity
A theory of delayed mutation of an unstable premutated gene is discussed and an interpretation and observations are offered which could alter slightly the expected pattern of inheritance
Eighty-eight other family members were screened for evidence of WBS and noteworthy findings are presented
